    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer container)
        Creates a new VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.Buffer instance backed by the specified container. Changes to the container's content will be visible to the struct buffer instance and vice versa. The two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent. The new buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and its limit will be the number of bytes remaining in this buffer divided by VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.SIZEOF, and its mark will be undefined.

        The created buffer instance holds a strong reference to the container object.

      • displayName

        public VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.Buffer displayName(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Encodes the specified CharSequence and sets the address of the encoded string to the displayName field.

        The encoded string must be explicitly freed with VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.Buffer.displayNameFree().

      • displayNameFree

        public VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.Buffer displayNameFree()
        Frees the string encoded by VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.Buffer.displayName(CharSequence) and stored in the displayName field.
